item.title: GA: 4. Quicksort
item.description: Statement This article is my study notes from the book: grokking algorithm: an illustrated guide for programmers and other curious people. Please refer to the original work for more details and indicate the source for reprinting. This chapter I learned divide-and-conquer and quicksort, both of which can help me solve problems elegently. 1. Divide & Conquer It can take us some time to understand D&C. Therefore, we will see some problems to learn about it.

Tips About Selection Sort Your computerâ€™s memory is like a giant set of drawers. When you want to store multiple elements, use an array or a list.
